amendment.description: Amendment sought to delete language which allows States to modify the designated uses of a waterway if it determines that the current use designation is infeasible or too costly to justify.
amendment.purpose: An amendment (printed as amendment No. 39 in the Congressional Record of May 9) to delete the provisions in the bill requiring the EPA to allow any state to modify the designated uses of a waterway if the state determines that the current use designation is infeasible or too costly to justify.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Nadler amendment (A015) Failed by recorded vote: 121 - 294 (Roll no. 322).
